reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed here for one night, but were made to feel very welcome from the minute we were dropped at the front door by the airport shuttle. Attentive staff, comfortable rooms, great location and fantastic breakfast on the balcony - there really isn't much more you can ask for. Close proximity to the beach as well as the shopping area and restaurants. Thoroughly enjoyable and we would recommend anyone to stay there!
reviews.title: Would love to have stayed longer...
Good but not great
reviews.text: Pros: very clean, historic looking (like the elevator), friendly staff, next to the beach and close to everything.

Cons: room too small. i have read before i booked that it's european style but i just can't get used to the confined space. it's a bit on the pricey side, $300. lastly, i paid extra 40 or 50 for the ocean view and it was a mistake because the metro bus stopping on Ocean Blvd right in front of the hotel is so loud, it got to point where i got really annoyed.
reviews.title: Great value for a great location

reviews.text: It's a bit older and has undergone a renovation, the bathrooms are a bit on the small size but given its location and price it is a great deal. The breakfast at the Veranda was great and you can't beat the view. Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the 4th hotel on our trip to California. We were tuned in to good vs bad hotel issues but the Georgian was excellent. It has a good atmosphere and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Our car always arrived quickly and there were enough towels for 3 etc. Breakfast was good - and a real opportunity to people watch. We won't name drop but had to resort to writing names on sugar packets and passing them around...
reviews.title: A Gem in a beautiful place!

reviews.text: We stayed at The Georgian Hotel in room 506 from 1/15-1/18. Our room was had two queen beds with a partial ocean view. Although our room was right next to the elevator (and I was worried about noise) there was no noise problem really. Santa Monica was not as great as I had hoped but the hotel overall is nice. Our room was large but had a small bathroom. Our TV and phone was not working when we arrived but they quickly sent someone up to fix the issues. There was one gentleman on the hotel staff (I did not get his name) that was very friendly but overall I found the rest of the staff business like and was surprised at the lack of knowledge and help regarding local restaurants and things to do. About half the time we pulled into the hotel or left the hotel there was no one to help with the car for about 5-10 minutes. Just an FYI, if you are in a hurry. The veranda is very lovely and we eat breakfast there every morning!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall this was a good hotel location for Santa Monica! The hotel was clean and the staff ok. We got a very good deal on TravelZoo which made this hotel worth it but I am not sure I would stay here at full price. What would help change my mind is if the staff was more friendly, out going and had more knowledge about the outer areas!
reviews.title: Excellent, Friendly Hotel
Successfully ESCAPED the Georgian
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights over the Xmas period. We had the suite deal where breakfast and luch was included. The quality of the room and food was outstanding. We had our meals on the veranda which faced the beach, it was perfect on a morning. The hotel was in an excellent location, just across the road from the beaches and next to lots of shops and restaurants. My only complaint about the suite deal, was that you were given breakfast vouchers for one particular breakfast, i would have preferred to have a set value and then choose what i wanted from the menu and pay the difference if necessary.

We just checked out early -- after day one of a two day stay. I'm giving them two stars instead of one because they didn't charge us for the second night even though we didn't leave until 2:45 because our next hotel wouldn't let us check in until 3. The main problem with the Georgian is that it has absolutely no working internet. None. They advertise free wifi. But don't believe it. They know they don't have it. We both need to work while we're on this nice two-day getaway for my husband's birthday. Not a lot but we both need internet access. It worked for maybe 1 minute yesterday, then nothing. We spent hours today (stupidly) trying to get it to work. I called the front desk and first they said "did you try the backup network?" Then they guy said he'd look into it but he never called back. The other big problem is that, while the ocean view suite we got was spectacular (and pretty cheap at $360 a night), the sheets had holes in them and when we got into bed last night we saw that there were all sorts of faded stains under the covers. Has this place really spent a bunch of money rennovating, but then totally cheaped out on clean, new sheets? What hotel actually puts sheets on their guests' bed with holes and stains? I have photos but it's gross and so I opted not to post them. We moved to the Fairmont which is a beautiful oasis. We also got a suite here for only $20 a night more, and when we told them about our experience at the Georgian the front desk guy threw in free internet for us! I'm so happy now. My computer works, we're still in a nice big suite, the Georgian graciously didn't charge us for the 2nd night, and I'm going to the bar in a minute at the Fairmont for a nice, relaxing drink in beautiful surroundings. There's a lot to be said for nice, working facilities. People like that sort of thing when they're paying a good sum of money for a hotel room. So sorry Georgian Hotel -- we won't be back.
reviews.title: Amazing location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect location on Ocean Blvd and literaly a two minute walk from the beach, pier, dozens of bars, restaurants, and shopping. We did not use a vehicle for three days. The hotel is vintage art deco and the rooms are newly renovated and very clean. Spend the extra for an ocean view room, the view is fantastic. The non-ocean rooms look out to parking lots and apt bldgs. The Verandah (off the lobby) gets very crowded for brkfst and lunch... don't waste your time, there are so many other options within a few steps. Helpful staff. Would not hesitate to revisit.
reviews.title: More than a deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast food was excellent with very good service. Staff friendly. Kindly let us extend our check out by 1.5 hours. Conveniently located to 3rd St. promenade and Santa Monica beach. Would stay there again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel at great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend had always commented on how pretty the veranda out front was, so for New Years I booked a room for two nights so we could enjoy it. Unfortunately, we did not have the experience we were hoping for. The staff was lazy, seemed disinterested, and had no knowledge of the city. The valet was never around, it was impossible to get your car or drop it off. We twice asked them to make up our room which they didn't, and then when they did come by the entered the room without even knocking. And the food was disgusting ( worst yet I found out anyone could eat there, only guests could order alcohol ). It was a nice view from an Ocean View room, but if you don't have that there's no reason to stay there.
reviews.title: Beautiful view from an ocean room, but the service is beyond terrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The great reviews for the Georgian are more than justified. The location is perfect with a great porch overlooking the ocean that is perfect for breakfast or drinks. We ate breakfast there twice and it was very good. The staff is very friendly and provided great service. The rooms are nice enough - not particularly large, but more than adequate and priced right. It's nice to stay in a place in LA where you only need to use your car when you want to, since there are a large number of restaurants, stores and the beach close nearby. This place is really a gem.
reviews.title: The Georgian is simply a great place to stay in Santa Monica

reviews.text: We had a great experience at the Georgian. We have been there before and will go back again. I just hope nothing changes!
reviews.title: We loved our stay at the Georgian

reviews.text: Spent 3 nights at the Georgian last week. This was just supposed to be a stopover to break up the flight from New York to Melbourne, but it turned out to be one of the highlights of the holiday. The hotel is in a great location - right on Ocean Avenue with Pallisades Park and the Pacific Ocean literally across the road, and just 10 minutes walk from Santa Monica Pier and 3rd Street Promenade. The rooms are spacious and clean and the staff extremely friendly and helpful. Watching the sunset from the veranda with a couple of their excellent margaritas is highly recommended!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in a great location
Gracious Georgian
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Georgian before, but this is my first review. I will definitely go back if I ever need to stay in the LA area. This hotel has a fabulous location, right across from the pier and a huge beach, and is a terrific value. I received a free upgrade to an ocean view, and this is the second time that's happened to me. (No, I am not a model--just a regular person). The rooms are super clean and the beds are comfy. There are some great restaurants in the area as well -- check out the happy hour sushi deals in the place on the corner of Ocean and Santa Monica, and you are just a couple of blocks from the 3d street promenade. Breakfast on the veranda was delicious. Staff was helpful with directions, etc.

reviews.title: Charming, unique hotel
reviews.text: My friend and I stayed here this past weekend and just loved the hotel. It has great, old Hollywood charm with friendly, attentive staff. An attendant quickly met us at our car when we pulled up and took our bags out and parked our car in the gararge ($21/day). The lobby was warm and inviting and the person at the desk quickly checked us in. The room had a fantastic view facing north so we saw the ocean and the hills. The bathroom had a beautiful tiled floor, Aveda products, plenty of clean towels and two ropes. The room was rather large with two large beds. The first morning we had breakfast on the porch and the staff could not have been more attentive. The breakfast was delicious too. The price was great for Santa Monica at $200/night (before all the crazy taxes that are added on and the additional car parking charge). I booked the room directly on their website after checking the variety of travel search programs that all came up with the same rate.

My six-year old daughter and I stayed at this hotel last week. We were only in the area for one-night, and I chose the Georgian because of its proximity to the beach and pier. I also wanted to stay there because of its history and because I am a big fan of Art Deco.
reviews.title: Hope to go Back!

reviews.text: I was very pleased with this choice, and my daughter was entranced by the way the hotel looked. We did not find the elevators to be slow and inconvenient as others have stated. It was a very short walk to the pier and the beach. The pier was perfect for entertaining her. She really enjoyed the man who stays by the carousel making huge bubbles for children to chase. We encountered a few homeless people but no one bothered us at all. I felt very safe the entire time. I found the hotel staff to be friendly and helpful, and was pleased by the amenities it offered. I would definitely recommend this place to others, and would love to stay there again.
reviews.title: Location , Location , Location

reviews.text: We spent 6 nights at the Georgian in early April with our 2 kids aged 14 and 10 and I would summarise as follows :
reviews.title: Wait until renovations are complete!
Great Location
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights after a round world trip and we are so glad we did after just having spent a week in New York.( Great place to chill out and wind down after so much travelling)
The staff were very helpful to us ( maybe they like Aussies) and our room was very clean and comfortable and the best bed we had slept in on our month long holiday.
reviews.title: Great hotel and staff
Lovely Time
reviews.text: Lovely outlook over Santa Monica Pier and easy to get around. Lots of buses and taxis right out front and a 20 min ride to Malibu or 5 mins to Venice beach.

reviews.title: I'll stay there again
reviews.text: Continental breakfast was included and was sufficient - great fruit !! well isn't this California !

reviews.title: Good location and very comfortable
reviews.text: We would definitely stay there again and I like to complain but had no complaints at this hotel - and the lifts are fun!!!!

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: I think this is a great hotel. The rooms are spascious and very clean, the hotel staff very personable. It was a comfortable atmosphere. I would definitely stay here again and also recommend the hotel to others.
I am a terribly picky, critical traveler... and I found nothing to hate about the Georgian. We had a city-view room (as opposed to an ocean-view) for a week, and liked it a lot.
reviews.title: I love this hotel (and I hate most hotels)

reviews.text: NOISE: I found the sound levels to be very low indeed (and I'm very sensitive). I don't know about the ocean-view rooms, but there are stodgy old apartment buildings on either side, and they're quiet. The hotel bar shuts down at 9:00 every night, which annoyed me at first, until I realized that it's a noise thing. (There are a dozen bars within two blocks, so this isn't inconvenient for us boozers.) And the walls appear to be solid 1930s plaster! Excellent sound insulation.
reviews.title: Very happy with our stay

reviews.text: STAFF: We found the staff to be attentive and solicitous.
reviews.title: will go back

reviews.text: DECOR: I loved the authentic 1930s decor. The bathroom tile may be recent, but the design is the real deal. And the ancient elevators are actually pretty cool.
reviews.title: a touch of south beach in southern cal

reviews.text: This was the final hotel we stayed in during a 4 week holiday taking us in a loop from Los Angeles, through Las Vegas, Zion, Yosemite and San Fransisco and should have been the perfect end to a great holiday.
reviews.title: Not as good as they think they are

reviews.text: We had high expectations for this hotel after reading some of the reviews, but we were very very disapointed with our stay.
reviews.title: Different Class

reviews.text: You have two choices for the rooms, ocean view or city view and its a trade off bewteen an uninspiring view or a sleepless night.
reviews.title: Not Nearly As Nice As Expected

reviews.text: The ocean views are quite stunning, but the street noise is totally unbearable and because the hotel management seem to be desperately clinging on to their selling point of being art deco, there isnt any sign of soundproofing on the windows.
reviews.title: On our honeymoon
Location,location
reviews.text: No matter how tired you are feeling and how appealing room service might sound, make the effort to go out for something to eat. Do not order anything from room service - the food was awful and cold.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked 4 nights in an 'ocean view queen' with the bed&breakfast package (which included breakfast and valet parking, cheaper than booking them separately, and probably cheaper than two breakfasts elsewhere), direct with the hotel on internet. Then a few weeks later cancelled and re-booked at a saving of $150 because the rates had changed! We were completely satisfied with the room, the hotel, the service and the location, even though it still seemed expensive to us Brits. The room and bathroom were not huge but plenty adequate for us two. The reception, bar and breakfast waiting staff were polite and helpful (although it's a pity the bar closes at 9:30 pm), the breakfast was ample and good, and being able to take it on the veranda in February was a special delight (for us Brits). The breakfast voucher allowed any of the breakfast options - more than enough choice. The mini-bar was expensive and one of those mean, annoying ones that register automatically when you lift anything out (although we weren't charged for the one thing we lifted and put back.) Internet was free and worked fine and immediately (even on my old Mac). As well as 3rd street shopping, there are some nice eating/drinking bars nearby (Oysterette, Pintxos) and a wholefood supermarket, and of course the beach and the pier. Overall, a great experience.
reviews.title: A great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in the Georgian on the return trip to LA from Las Vegas before flying out 2 days later. We'd stayed in the Shangri La earlier in the holiday but decided to try the Georgian on the recommendation of some friends. Don't get me wrong, the hotel is lovely, especially eating breakfast on the veranda outside watching the world go by. The only problem we found was that the price per night was quite a bit more than the Shangri La yet it wasn't any better what so ever. In fact the room was looking a bit tired, housekeeping left our door open after cleaning and the waiting staff quite rudely stated my "second orange juice was not free" as if I'd just fallen in off the street and all I wanted was free juice!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, but not sure it lives up to the hype.

reviews.text: I'm loathe to write a bad review for this place because apart from the above it was a great stay, the concierge was excellent, ringing ahead to our chosen restaurant and pointing us in the direction of the highlights of Santa Monica. It's just that for the price I expected a little bit more, maybe being number one for so long has gone to their heads?
reviews.title: Great Location and Comfortable Room but....

reviews.text: Overall, a really lovely spot, a very good deal for the price, but there are just a couple of things that prevent me from giving this a complete rave. First, the queen rooms are a bit on the small size. Worth booking a queen/queen (which I switched too on day two, when my friend arrived) even if you are on your own, just for the breathing room. And the front desk assistance is a bit spotty. I had an very helpful woman check me in, but when we called down for a couple of things, we had problems (called for car, message didn't get relayed to valet, called because our room didn't have a corkscrew, 30 minutes later we just gave up and went to the bar). Also, the internet service is really not good. Despite that, there is a lot of great things about the hotel - rooms are very nicely decorated, comfortable beds, the Art Deco history has been well preserved and has a lot of charm, and everyone was very friendly. Bathrooms are small but cute. The best thing the hotel has going for it though is it's location. Absolutely I'd stay again, but I'd know I need to pay a bit more attention to service requests.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel, Fantastic Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a return trip for me to The Georgian Hotel but on this occasion I was travelling alone and I would not hesitate to recommend it to solo travellers. This hotel has an individual style which makes a pleasant change from the usual characterless chains and the staff are genuine, helpful and friendly. I had a good-sized room with beautiful linen and wonderful views over the ocean & Santa Monica pier. The Veranda Cafe is a great place to people watch and the prices are very reasonable. I would recommend enjoying a cocktail there while watching the sun setting through the palm trees. The hotel is located a convenient three minute walk from the Third Street shopping area which was ideal for dropping off shopping bags.
reviews.title: Perfect location, beautiful hotel
